title: David's Praise and Trust
shortSummary: Psalm 138 is a heartfelt psalm of thanksgiving and trust in God by David. It expresses wholehearted praise for God's steadfast love, faithfulness, and His attentive care even in times of trouble, highlighting God's exaltation and mercy toward the humble.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, King of Israel, who expresses deep personal praise and trust in God's faithfulness.

keyCharacters.name: Kings of the Earth
keyCharacters.description: Representing all rulers who will ultimately acknowledge and praise the LORD upon hearing His words.

definitions.definition: God’s steadfast, covenantal love and mercy toward His people.
The sacred place where God’s presence dwells and where worship is directed.
A biblical symbol of power and deliverance, representing God's saving strength.
Those who are arrogant and self-reliant, contrasted with the humble who receive God’s favor.

outline.heading: David’s Wholehearted Praise
outline.description: David begins by declaring his full-hearted praise to God, acknowledging His lovingkindness and truth, and exalting God’s word above all His name, emphasizing the supreme authority of God's promises.

outline.heading: God’s Faithful Answer and Universal Praise
outline.description: David recalls God’s personal response to his cries for help and foretells that all earthly kings will praise the LORD, recognizing His glorious ways and the greatness of His glory.

outline.heading: God’s Favor Toward the Humble
outline.description: Though God is exalted, He shows special regard for the lowly and distances Himself from the proud, highlighting the biblical principle of humility before God.

outline.heading: God’s Protection and Salvation
outline.description: David expresses confidence that God will revive and protect him amid troubles, stretching out His powerful hand against enemies to bring salvation.

outline.heading: God’s Perfecting Work and Enduring Mercy
outline.description: The psalm concludes with a declaration of God’s commitment to complete His work in David’s life, underscoring the eternal nature of God’s mercy and a plea for God not to abandon His handiwork.

application: Offer God wholehearted praise in all circumstances, recognizing His lovingkindness and faithfulness.
Trust God to answer prayers and provide strength during times of trouble.
Practice humility, knowing that God honors the lowly and resists the proud.
Rely on God’s protection and salvation, confident that He will complete His good work in your life.

keyVerses.text: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the supreme value of God's promises and faithfulness, encouraging believers to trust His word above all.

keyVerses.text: Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.
keyVerses.significance: It teaches the vital biblical principle that God favors the humble and distances Himself from pride.

keyVerses.text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God’s power to protect and revive His people amid adversity.

keyVerses.text: The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.
keyVerses.significance: It expresses confidence in God’s ongoing work and enduring mercy, encouraging believers to trust in His faithfulness to complete His purposes.
